page.title: 06FOLK LORE
page.content: Building of Inverlussa Manse.When the fishermen from Achnamara landed in Ireland they stole some slates from a monastery to put on the Manse roof.When the Irish priest discovered they were to be used for a Scottish Manse it is said that he cursed the building. Stone Bridge,Achnamara.On the shore of Loch Sween between the road bridge and the loch at the south side of the village,is the very old clapper bridge.It is said that when this bridge was built,local people who would not attend church were punished by having to help build the bridge. It is formed of two slabs 13'3" and 10'5" supported on 3 piers.
